column4: I installed Ubuntu 9.10 Netbook Remix on my asus eee 900 yesterday, and it works fine except the connection speed on my home network seems to be mortally slow. Any idea why? (repeated question, sorry)
can you make sure it is not a network or bandwidth issue?
my gf's computer with vista handles the network perfectly
what is your wireless chip
what do I type to find out?
lspci -v
or  lsusb  for usb wireless device
Atheros AR5001
it worked out of the box without manually installing any driver right?
yes, and it works flawlessly on my uni's network
in the lspci -v output, what is the driver in use?
ath5k
um...  try sudo modprobe ath9k
no response
I just got the prompt back immediately
now lspci -v  again
exactly same output as before
a google on  AR5001 linux performance  give me this http://bbs.archlinux.org/viewtopic.php?id=60759
doesn't really help, though. I have the latest kernel, and the modprobe for ath9k didn't do anything.
no clue
thanks anyway
